title: My Portfolio
text:
Welcome to a Churn Analysis Project.
Click on DSA306 Customer Churn Prediction Analysis to look at our project.

title: About
text:
About our dataset





Variable
Meaning
DataType
Notes




CustomerID
Unique Identifier that identifies each customer
int
NA


Age
Age of the customer in years
int
NA


Gender
Gender of the customer
chr
Male or Female


Tenure
Total amount of of months the customer has been with the company
int
NA


Usage Frequency
How often the customer uses the service
int
NA


Support Calls
Number of customer support calls made by the customer
int
NA


Payment Delay
Number of days a customer's payment is delayed.
int
NA


Subscription Type
Type of subscription the customer subscribed for
chr
Standard, Basic or Premium


Contract Length
Length of customer's contract
chr
Annual, Monthly or Quarterly


Total Spend
Total amount spent by the customer on the service in USD
num
NA


Last Interaction
The number of days since the customer's last interaction with the company
int
NA


Churn
Whether the customer has churned or not
int
Churned = 1, Not Churned = 0

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
text:
Attaching package: 'arrow'


The following object is masked from 'package:utils':

    timestamp



Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union



Attaching package: 'sparklyr'


The following object is masked from 'package:stats':

    filter




# A tibble: 1 × 12
  CustomerID   Age Gender Tenure `Usage Frequency` `Support Calls`
       <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>             <dbl>           <dbl>
1          1     1      0      1                 1               1
# ℹ 6 more variables: `Payment Delay` <dbl>, `Subscription Type` <dbl>,
#   `Contract Length` <dbl>, `Total Spend` <dbl>, `Last Interaction` <dbl>,
#   Churn <dbl>







   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
  18.00   29.00   39.00   39.37   48.00   65.00 


Looking at the distribution by age, a large portion of our dataset comes from aged 40-50 years old and a low portion comes from age 50-60 years old.
The statistic summary of age shows that the mean age is 39.37 and it’s ranging from 18 to 65 years old.





From the Gender Distribution bar chart, we are able to see that we have more Male than Female in this dataset.





   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
   1.00   16.00   32.00   31.26   46.00   60.00 


Looking at the Distribution by Tenure, it is apparent that the dataset exhibits a generally balanced distribution where majority of Tenure values hover around range of 7000 - 8000 in terms of count. However, for tenure values falling within the ranges of 10-20 and 0-5, there is a slight drop with counts ranging from 6000 to 7000, indicating a comparatively lower frequency of occurrences within these specific tenure ranges.”
The statistic summary of tenure shows that the dataset mean tenure is 31.26 and it’s ranging from 1 to 60 Tenure.





   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
   1.00    9.00   16.00   15.81   23.00   30.00 


Looking at the Distribution by Usage Frequency, it is obvious that the dataset exhibits a generally balanced distribution where majority of Tenure values hover around range of 15000 in terms of count. However, for Usage Frequency values < 10, the counts is slightly lower.
The statistic summary of Usage Frequency shows that the dataset mean Usage Frequency is 15.81 and it’s ranging from 1 to 30 Usage Frequency.





   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
  0.000   1.000   3.000   3.604   6.000  10.000 


Looking at the Distribution by Support Calls, there is a downward trend in terms of counts as support calls increases. Support calls of 5 onward has a stable frequency of around 20000.
The statistic summary of Support Calls shows that the dataset mean Support Calls is 3.604 and it’s ranging from 0 to 10 calls.

title: DSA306 Customer Churn Prediction Analysis
text:
Dataset codebook





Variable
Meaning
DataType
Notes




CustomerID
Unique Customer Identifier
String
NA


Age
Customer's Age in Years
Integer
18 to 65


Gender
Customer's Gender
String
Male or Female


Tenure
Length of Customer Subscription in Months
Integer
1 to 60


Usage Frequency
Customer’s Frequency of Daily Service Usage
Integer
1 to 30


Support Calls
Number of Support Calls made by Customer
Integer
0 (None) to 10


Payment Delay
Customer’s Payment Delay in Days
Integer
0 (None) to 30


Subscription Type
Chosen Subscription by Customer
String
Basic, Standard or Premium


Contract Length
Customer Service Contract Duration
String
Monthly, Quarterly or Annually


Total Spend
Customer Total Spending on Service in USD
Float
NA


Last Interaction
Days since Customer Last Interact with the Company
Integer
1 to 30


Churn
Customer Discontinuation with the Service
Integer
1 (Yes) or 0 (No)







Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)


FileSystemDataset (query)
CustomerID: string
Age: int64
Gender: string
Tenure: int64
Usage Frequency: int64
Support Calls: int64
Payment Delay: int64
Subscription Type: string
Contract Length: string
Total Spend: float
Last Interaction: int64
Churn: int64

See $.data for the source Arrow object
